question: Which protein is encoded by the protein APOBEC3C?
ideal_answer: The gene APOBEC3C codes for: apolipoprotein B mRNA editing enzyme catalytic polypeptide-like 3C

snippets.text: apolipoprotein B mRNA-editing enzyme catalytic polypeptide-like 3 (APOBEC3; shortened here to A3), act by deaminating cytidines to uridines during the reverse transcription reaction of HIV-1.
apolipoprotein B mRNA editing enzyme catalytic polypeptide-like 3C (APOBEC3C)
apolipoprotein B mRNA editing enzyme catalytic subunit (APOBEC)3A,
apolipoprotein B mRNA-editing enzyme catalytic subunit 3C (APOBEC3C, a nucleic acid-editing deaminase)

exact_answer: apolipoprotein B mRNA editing enzyme catalytic polypeptide-like 3C
